25:T953,<entryFree id="n15484" key="رَسِلَ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <itype>1</itype>        
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">رَسِلَ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form>, aor.      
    <form n="infl">       
                     <orth orig="Ba" lang="ar">رَسَلَ</orth>
                  </form>, inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">رَسَلٌ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">رَسَالَ</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">He</hi> (a camel) <hi rend="ital">was,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">became, easy in pace.</hi> (M, K.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  Also, aor.      
    <form n="infl">       
                     <orth orig="Ba" lang="ar">رَسَلَ</orth>
                  </form>, inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">رَسَلٌ</foreign> (AZ, Az, Msb, K) and <foreign lang="ar">رَسَالَةٌ</foreign>, as above, (AZ, Az, K,) <hi rend="ital">It</hi> (hair) <hi rend="ital">became lank, not crisp;</hi> (Msb, K;) and so   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n15484-1" target="استرسل" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n15490"/></foreign>: (S, K:) or <hi rend="ital">lank</hi> and <hi rend="ital">pendent:</hi> (Msb:) or <hi rend="ital">long,</hi> and <hi rend="ital">lank</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pendent.</hi> (AZ, Az, Msb.) <foreign lang="ar">لَا يَجِبُ غَسْلُ مَا <ref cref="n15484-2" target="ٱسْتَرْسَلَ" n="2" type="6" subtype="FTFSO" lang="ar"/> مِنَ البِّحْيَةِ</foreign> means [<hi rend="ital">The washing</hi>] <hi rend="ital">of what hangs down,</hi> and <hi rend="ital">descends,</hi> [<hi rend="ital">of the beard,</hi>] from the chin [<hi rend="ital">is not requisite,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">necessary,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">incumbent</hi>]. (Mgh.)       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  [Golius says, as on the authority of the KL, that <foreign lang="ar">رَسَلَ</foreign> signifies <hi rend="ital">Nuncium misit:</hi> but what I find in the KL is, that <foreign lang="ar">رَسُولٌ</foreign>, as an inf. n., signifies the <hi rend="ital">bringing a message</hi> (<foreign lang="ar">پيغام بردن</foreign>) : whence it seems that <foreign lang="ar">رَسَلَ</foreign> means <hi rend="ital">he brought a message.</hi>]    </entryFree>26:T9a0,<entryFree id="n15485" key="تَرْسِيلٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <itype>2</itype>        
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">تَرْسِيلٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form>, in reading, or reciting, (Msb, K,) <hi rend="ital">i. q.</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">تَرْتِيلٌ</foreign>; (K, TA;) i. e. (TA) <hi rend="ital">Easy</hi> [or <hi rend="ital">leisurely</hi>] <hi rend="ital">utterance; without haste:</hi> (Yz, Msb, TA:) or, as some say, <hi rend="ital">with consecution of the parts,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">portions:</hi> (TA:) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n15485-1" target="تَرَسُّلٌ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> therein signifies the same: (Yz, Msb:) or <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n15485-2" target="تَرَسَّلَ" n="2" type="8" subtype="FSOTF" lang="ar"/>فِى قِرّآءَتِهِ</foreign> signifies <hi rend="ital">he proceeded in a leisurely manner in his reading,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reciting,</hi> (S, Mgh, Msb, K,) <hi rend="ital">and was grave, staid, sedate,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">calm,</hi> (Mgh,) <hi rend="ital">and endeavoured to understand, without raising his voice much.</hi> (TA.) It is said in a trad., <foreign lang="ar">كَانَ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">فِى كَلَامِهِ تَرْسِيلٌ</foreign> i. e. <foreign lang="ar">تَرْتِيلٌ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">There was in his</hi> (Mohammad's) <hi rend="ital">speech an easy,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a leisurely, utterance</hi>]. (TA.) And in another trad. it is said, <foreign lang="ar">إذَا أَذَّنْتَ <ref cref="n15485-3" target="فَتَرَسَّلْ" n="3" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar"/>وَإِذَا أَقَمْتَ فَٱحْذِمْ</foreign> [expl. in art. <foreign lang="ar">حذم</foreign>]. (Mgh.)       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  See also 4, last sentence but one.       <sense type="A" n="3">-A3-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">رَسَّلْتُ فُصْلَانِى</foreign>, inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">تَرْسِيلٌ</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">I gave to drink</hi> [<hi rend="ital">to my young camels,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">my young weaned camels,</hi>] <foreign lang="ar">رِسْل</foreign> (K, TA,) i. e. <hi rend="ital">milk.</hi> (TA.)    </entryFree>27:Td73,<entryFree id="n15486" key="راسلهُ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <itype>3</itype>        
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">راسلهُ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> (S, MA,) inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">مُرَاسَلَةٌ</foreign>, (S,) <hi rend="ital">He sent a message,</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a letter,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">an epistle, to him,</hi> (MA, PS,) <hi rend="ital">the latter doing the like:</hi> (PS:) [<hi rend="ital">he interchanged messages,</hi> and <hi rend="ital">letters, with him.</hi>] You say, <foreign lang="ar">راسلهُ فِى كَذَا</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">He interchanged messages,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">letters, with him, in relation to such a thing</hi>]: and <foreign lang="ar">بَيْنَهُمَا مُرَاسَلَاتٌ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">Between them two are interchanges of messages,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of letters</hi>]. (TA.) And <foreign lang="ar">هَىَ تُرَاسِلُ الخُطَّابَ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">She interchanges messages,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">letters, with those who demand women in marriage</hi>]. (M, K.) And <foreign lang="ar">تُرَاسِلُهُ بِالخُطَّابِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">She interchanges messages,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">letters, with him by means of those who demand women in marriage</hi>]. (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  [Hence,] <foreign lang="ar">راسلهُ فِى نِضَالٍ أَوْ غَيْرِهِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">He acted interchangeably,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">alternated, with him in a competition in shooting, or in some other performance</hi>]. (S.) And <foreign lang="ar">راسلهُ فِى الغِنَآءِ</foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar">العَمَلِ</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">He relieved him,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aided him, in singing, and in work,</hi> [<hi rend="ital">by alternating with him,</hi> i. e.,] <hi rend="ital">in the former case, by taking up the strain when the latter was unable to continue it</hi> [<hi rend="ital">so as to accomplish the cadence</hi> (see 6)], <hi rend="ital">and in the latter case by taking up the work when the latter person was unable to continue it;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">he so relieved,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aided, him in singing with a high voice:</hi> or <foreign lang="ar">راسلهُ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">فِى عَمَلِهِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">he aided him,</hi> [or <hi rend="ital">relieved him, by alternating with him,</hi>] or <hi rend="ital">he followed him,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">imitated him, in his work:</hi> (IAar, Msb:) and <foreign lang="ar">راسلهُ الغِنَآءَ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">he emulated him,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">imitated him,</hi> [<hi rend="ital">by alternating with him,</hi>] <hi rend="ital">in the singing.</hi> (TA.) And <foreign lang="ar">راسلهُ فِى</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">القِرَآءَة</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He aided him,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">assisted him,</hi> [or <hi rend="ital">relieved him, by alternating with him,</hi>] <hi rend="ital">in the reading,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reciting,</hi> of the Kur-án &amp;c. (MA.)    </entryFree>28:T1a42,<entryFree id="n15487" key="إِرْسَالٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <itype>4</itype>        
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">إِرْسَالٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> signifies The act of <hi rend="ital">sending.</hi> (K, KL, &amp;c.) Thus is explained <foreign lang="ar">إِرْسَالُ ٱللّٰهِ أَنْبِيَآءَهُ</foreign> [i. e. <hi rend="ital">God's sending his prophets.</hi>] (Th, TA.) You say,   
      <foreign lang="ar">أَرْسَلْتُ فُلَانًا فِى <ref cref="n15487-1" target="رِسَالَةٍ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> (S) <hi rend="ital">I sent such a one with a message.</hi> (PS.) And   
      <foreign lang="ar">ارسل إِلَيْهِ <ref cref="n15487-2" target="رَسُولًا" n="2" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> (MA, Msb *) <hi rend="ital">He sent to him a message,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a letter,</hi> (MA,) or <hi rend="ital">a messenger.</hi> (Msb.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  [The act of <hi rend="ital">sending forth,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">starting,</hi> a horse for a race: the <hi rend="ital">discharging</hi> a thing; as, for instance, an arrow from a bow; and water, or the like, from a vessel &amp;c. in which it was confined: the <hi rend="ital">launching forth</hi> a ship or boat; <hi rend="ital">letting</hi> it <hi rend="ital">go; letting</hi> it <hi rend="ital">take its course:</hi>] the act of <hi rend="ital">setting loose</hi> or <hi rend="ital">free; letting loose; loosing, unbinding,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">liberating.</hi> (K.)                   <hi rend="ital">He set loose</hi> or <hi rend="ital">free,</hi> &amp;c., <hi rend="ital">the thing.</hi> (M.) And <foreign lang="ar">أَرْسَلْتُ الطَّائِرَ مِنْ يَدِى</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">I let go,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">let loose, the bird from my hand.</hi> (Msb.) And [hence,] <foreign lang="ar">ارسل الحُرُوفَ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">He uttered the letters</hi>]. (Mgh in art. <foreign lang="ar">رتل</foreign>.) (A in art. <foreign lang="ar">برد</foreign>.) And <foreign lang="ar">ارسل الكَلَامَ</foreign> <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  <hi rend="ital">He made the speech,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">language, to be unrestricted.</hi> (Msb.) [In like manner,] <foreign lang="ar">إِرْسَالٌ</foreign> signifies also <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  The <hi rend="ital">making</hi> a thing, such as property, and a legacy, <hi rend="ital">absolute,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unrestricted.</hi> (Mgh.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  [The act of <hi rend="ital">letting down, letting fall,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">making to hang down,</hi> the hair &amp;c. (M.) [Hence,] one says, <foreign lang="ar">ارسلهُ عَنْ يَدِهِ</foreign> <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">He left, forsook,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">deserted, him;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">he abstained from,</hi> 
                  <pb n="1082"/> or <hi rend="ital">neglected, aiding him,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">assisting him.</hi> (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="5">-b5-</sense>  Also The act of <hi rend="ital">making to have dominion,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">authority, and power; making to have,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">exercise, absolute dominion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sovereignty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rule,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absolute superiority of power</hi> or <hi rend="ital">force;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">giving power,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">superior power</hi> or <hi rend="ital">force.</hi> (M, K.)                   <foreign lang="ar">الكَافِرِينَ تَؤُزُّهُمْ أَزًّا</foreign>, i. e. [<hi rend="ital">We have made the devils to have dominion,</hi> &amp;c., <hi rend="ital">over the unbelievers, inciting them strongly</hi> to acts of disobedience; or] <hi rend="ital">we have appointed,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prepared, the devils for the unbelievers,</hi> because of their unbelief; like as is said in the same [xliii. 35], <foreign lang="ar">نُقَيِّضْ لَهُ شَيْطَانًا</foreign> [“ We will appoint, or prepare, for him a devil ” as an associate]: this is the preferred explanation: [or it may be well rendered <hi rend="ital">we have sent the devils against the unbelievers:</hi>] some say that the meaning is, <hi rend="ital">we have left the devils to do as they please with the unbelievers, not withholding them,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">preserving them, from acceptance from them.</hi> (Zj, M.)       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">ارسلوا</foreign> [from <foreign lang="ar">رِسْلٌ</foreign>] <hi rend="ital">They had milk in their cattle:</hi> (S:) or <hi rend="ital">their milk became much;</hi> as also   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n15487-3" target="رسّلوا" n="3" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n15484"/></foreign>, inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">تَرْسِيلٌ</foreign>: (K:) or the latter signifies <hi rend="ital">their milk and drink became much.</hi> (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  Also [from <foreign lang="ar">رَسَلٌ</foreign>] <hi rend="ital">They became possessors of herds</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flocks.</hi> (O, K. *)    </entryFree>29:T6ea,<entryFree id="n15488" key="ترسّل" type="main">

                  <hi rend="ital">He acted,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">behaved, gently,</hi> and <hi rend="ital">deliberately,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leisurely,</hi> (M, K, TA,) and <hi rend="ital">with gravity, staidness, sedateness,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">calmness.</hi> (TA.) <foreign lang="ar">التَّرَسُّلُ فِى الأُمُورِ</foreign> is <hi rend="ital">The acting,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">behaving,</hi> [<hi rend="ital">gently,</hi> and] <hi rend="ital">deliberately,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leisurely,</hi> and <hi rend="ital">with gravity, staidness, sedateness,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">calmness, in affairs.</hi> (TA.) See also 2, in three places.          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">التَّرَسُّلُ</foreign> in riding is <hi rend="ital">The extending one's legs upon the beast so as to let,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">make, his clothes hang down loosely upon his legs:</hi> and in sitting, <hi rend="ital">the crossing one's legs, and letting,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">making, his clothes hang down loosely upon them and around him.</hi> (TA.)       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">ترسّلا بَيْنَ القَوْمِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">He acted as a</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">رَسُول</foreign> (or <hi rend="ital">messenger</hi>) <hi rend="ital">between the people</hi>]. (Msb and TA in art. <foreign lang="ar">الك</foreign>.)    </entryFree>2a:T74d,<entryFree id="n15489" key="تراسلوا" type="main">

                     <itype>6</itype>        
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">تراسلوا</orth>

                  <hi rend="ital">They sent, one to another,</hi> (MA, Msb, TA,) <hi rend="ital">a message</hi> [or <hi rend="ital">messages</hi>], (MA, Msb,) or <hi rend="ital">a messenger</hi> [or <hi rend="ital">messengers</hi>]. (Msb.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  Hence, <foreign lang="ar">تراسلوا فِى الغِنَآءِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">They relieved,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aided, one another alternately in singing;</hi>] i. e. <hi rend="ital">they combined in singing, one beginning, and prolonging his voice, but being unable to continue long enough to accomplish the cadence, and therefore pausing, and another then taking up the strain, and then the first returning to the modulation, and so on to the end.</hi> (Msb.) <foreign lang="ar">لَا تَرَاسُلَ فِى الأَذَانِ</foreign> means [in like manner] <hi rend="ital">There shall be no relieving,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aiding, one another</hi> [<hi rend="ital">alternately</hi>], i. e., <hi rend="ital">no combining</hi> [<hi rend="ital">of two or more persons, each performing a part alternately</hi>], <hi rend="ital">in the chanting of the call to prayer.</hi> (Msb.) [In other cases likewise] <foreign lang="ar">التَّرَاسُلُ</foreign> signifies <hi rend="ital">The doing the like of that which one's companion,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fellow,</hi> [or <hi rend="ital">another,</hi>] <hi rend="ital">does, in such a manner as that one follows another</hi> [<hi rend="ital">alternately</hi>].                   <hi rend="ital">It</hi> (a thing) <hi rend="ital">was,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">became, loose,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slack;</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">سَلِسَ</foreign>. (M, TA.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  Said of hair: see 1, in two places. [In like manner said of a tree, &amp;c., <hi rend="ital">It drooped;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">was pendent.</hi> Said of a cheek, (to which its part. n. <foreign lang="ar">مُسْتَرْسِلٌ</foreign> is applied as an epithet in the K voce <foreign lang="ar">أَسِيلٌ</foreign>,) <hi rend="ital">It was,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">became, lank.</hi>]          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">الاِسْتِرْسَالُ</foreign> in the pace of a beast is <hi rend="ital">The going gently, deliberately,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leisurely.</hi> (TA.) [And you say, <foreign lang="ar">استرسلت الدَّابَّةٌ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">The beast went a gentle, deliberate,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leisurely, pace.</hi>]          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  Also, [in other cases,] <hi rend="ital">The being still,</hi> and <hi rend="ital">steady.</hi> (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="5">-b5-</sense>  Hence, (TA,) <foreign lang="ar">استرسل إِلَيْهِ</foreign> <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">He acted,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">behaved, towards him with freedom, boldness, forwardness,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">presumptuousness,</hi> and <hi rend="ital">with familiarity;</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">اِنْبَسَطَ</foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar">اِسْتَأْنَسَ</foreign>; (S, K, TA;) and <hi rend="ital">was at ease, and confided in him, with respect to that which he told him:</hi> (TA:) or <hi rend="ital">he acted forwardly,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">impudently, towards him: he acted forwardly, impudently, freely,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">familiarly, towards him, in the way of coquetry,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">feigned disdain.</hi> (MA.)          <sense type="b" n="6">-b6-</sense>  And <foreign lang="ar">استرسل الدَّهْرُ</foreign>

(TA in art. <foreign lang="ar">بهل</foreign>)       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  Also <hi rend="ital">He said, Send thou to me the camels in droves</hi> (<foreign lang="ar">أَرْسَالًا</foreign> [in the CK, erroneously, <foreign lang="ar">اِرْسالًا</foreign>]); (K, TA;) <foreign lang="ar">ارسالا</foreign> being with fet-h to the hemzeh; i. e. <hi rend="ital">drove after drove:</hi> for the camels, when they come to the water, are numerous; and their tender brings them to the watering-trough thus; not all together, as in this case they would press together upon the watering-trough and not satisfy their thirst. (TA.)    </entryFree>2c:Tff6,<entryFree id="n15491" key="رَسْلٌ" type="main">

                  <hi rend="ital">Easy;</hi> applied to a pace. (M, K.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">Easy in pace;</hi> applied to a he-camel: fem. with <foreign lang="ar">ة</foreign>: (S, M, K:) or <hi rend="ital">soft,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gentle, in pace;</hi> applied to a he-camel and to a she-camel: (Msb:) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n15491-1" target="مِرْسَالٌ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n15507"/></foreign>, also, applied to a she-camel, has the former of these significations; and its pl. is <foreign lang="ar">مَرَاسِيلُ</foreign>: (S, K:) or this pl. signifies <hi rend="ital">light,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">active,</hi> she-camels, <hi rend="ital">that give thee what they have to give spontaneously;</hi> and <foreign lang="ar">رَسْلَةٌ</foreign> is applied to one thereof: a she-camel is termed   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n15491-2" target="مِرْسَالٌ" n="2" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n15507"/></foreign> as being likened to the arrow thus called. (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">Soft, and lax,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flaccid:</hi> [app. applied to a he-camel; for it is added,] one says <foreign lang="ar">نَاقَةٌ رَسْلَةٌ القَوَائِمِ</foreign>, meaning <hi rend="ital">A she-camel loose,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slack,</hi> [<hi rend="ital">in the legs,</hi> and] <hi rend="ital">soft in the joints</hi> [<hi rend="ital">thereof</hi>]. (TA. [See also another meaning assigned to this phrase in what follows.])          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  Applied to hair, <hi rend="ital">i. q.</hi>   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n15491-3" target="مُسْتَرْسِلٌ" n="3" type="1" subtype="SO" lang="ar" select="n15509"/></foreign>; (S, K; in the CK <foreign lang="ar">مُرْسَل</foreign>;) which means <hi rend="ital">Lank; not crisp:</hi> (Mgh, Msb: [and so accord. to an explanation of <foreign lang="ar">استرسل</foreign> in the S and K:]) or <hi rend="ital">lank</hi> and <hi rend="ital">pendent:</hi> (Msb:) or <hi rend="ital">long,</hi> and <hi rend="ital">lank</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pendent.</hi> (AZ, Az, Msb.)          <sense type="b" n="5">-b5-</sense>  And <foreign lang="ar">رَسْلَةٌ</foreign>, (M,) or <foreign lang="ar">رَسْلَةُ القَوائِمِ</foreign>, [of which see an explanation in what precedes,] (L, TA,) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n15491-4" target="مِرْسَالٌ" n="4" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n15507"/></foreign>, applied to a she-camel, (M, L, TA,) <hi rend="ital">Having much hair,</hi> (M,) or <hi rend="ital">much and long hair,</hi> (L, TA,) <hi rend="ital">upon her shanks,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hind legs</hi> (<foreign lang="ar">فِى سَاقِيْهَا</foreign>): (M, L, TA:) but in the K, <foreign lang="ar">رَسْلَةٌ</foreign> and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n15491-5" target="مُرَاسِلٌ" n="5" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n15508"/></foreign> [not <foreign lang="ar">مِرْسَالٌ</foreign>] are explained as epithets applied to a woman, meaning <hi rend="ital">having much and long hair upon her shanks.</hi> (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="6">-b6-</sense>  Also sing. of

(AZ, TA.)       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  See also <foreign lang="ar">مُرَاسِلٌ</foreign>.       <sense type="A" n="3">-A3-</sense>  And see the paragraph here next following.    </entryFree>2d:T156c,<entryFree id="n15492" key="رِسْلٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">رِسْلٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> 
                  <hi rend="ital">Gentleness;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a deliberate,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leisurely, manner of acting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">behaving;</hi> as also   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n15492-1" target="رِسْلَةٌ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n15496"/></foreign>; (M, K;) [and perhaps   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n15492-2" target="رَسْلٌ" n="2" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n15491"/></foreign> and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n15492-3" target="رَسْلَةٌ" n="3" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n15495"/></foreign>; for] one says <foreign lang="ar">اِفْعَلْ كَذَا وَكَذَا عَلَى رِسْلِكَ</foreign> (S, Mgh, * Msb, * CK * [but not in my MS. copy of the K nor in the copies used by SM]) and <foreign lang="ar">رَسْلِكَ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">رَسْلَتِكَ</foreign>, (CK, [but likewise wanting in MS. copies of the K,]) i. e. [<hi rend="ital">Do thou such and such things</hi>] <hi rend="ital">at thine ease;</hi> (Msb;) or <hi rend="ital">act thou gently, deliberately,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leisurely,</hi> (S, Mgh, K, *) <hi rend="ital">in doing such and such things;</hi> like as one says, <foreign lang="ar">عَلَى هِينَتِكَ</foreign>. (S.) Sakhr-el-Ghei says, when despairing of his companions' overtaking him, his enemies surrounding him, and he feeling sure of slaughter, (M,) <quote>
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">لَوْ أَنَّ حَوْلِى مِنْ قُرَيْمٍ رَجْلَا</foreign>
                     </L> 
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">بِيضَ الوَجُوهِ يَحْمِلُونَ النَّبْلَا</foreign>
                     </L> 
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">لَمَنَعُونِى نَجْدَةً أَوْ رِسْلَا</foreign>
                     </L> 
                  </quote> (Skr, M, *) i. e. [<hi rend="ital">If there were around me,</hi> of the family <hi rend="ital">of Kureym, men on foot, fair in the faces</hi> (app. meant tropically), <hi rend="ital">bearing arrows, they would defend me</hi>] <hi rend="ital">by violent means</hi> or <hi rend="ital">by gentle means:</hi> (Skr:) or <hi rend="ital">with fighting or without fighting.</hi> (M.) [See also a phrase cited from a trad. in what follows of this paragraph.] One says also,   
      <foreign lang="ar">جَاؤُوا رِسْلَةً <ref cref="n15492-4" target="رِسْلَةً" n="4" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">They came company by company.</hi> (M.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  And A <hi rend="ital">soft, gentle,</hi> saying or speech. (TA.)       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  Also <hi rend="ital">Milk,</hi> (S, M, K,) <hi rend="ital">of whatever sort it be:</hi> (M, K:) or, accord. to the Towsheeh, <hi rend="ital">fresh milk.</hi> (TA.) One says, <foreign lang="ar">كَثُرَ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">الرِّسْلُ العَامَ</foreign>, meaning <hi rend="ital">Milk has become abundant this year:</hi> and the people of the desert assert that, when this is the case, dates are few; and that, when dates are abundant, milk is scarce. (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  It is said in a trad. [respecting the giving of the poor-rate], <foreign lang="ar">إِلَّا مَنْ أَعْطَى فِى نَجْدَتِهَا وَرِسْلِهَا</foreign>, (S, TA,) which is explained in two different ways: (TA:) [J says that] it is from <foreign lang="ar">رِسْلٌ</foreign> in the sense first explained above; meaning straitness and plenty; i. e. <hi rend="ital">Except him who gives when they are fat and goodly,</hi> when it is difficult, or hard, to their owner to give them forth, <hi rend="ital">and when they are lean,</hi> [or] <hi rend="ital">in a middling condition:</hi> (S:) and A'Obeyd says the like; and that it is similar to the saying, <foreign lang="ar">قَالَ فُلَانٌ كَذَا عَمَّا رِسْلِهِ</foreign>, meaning <hi rend="ital">Such a one said such a thing holding it</hi> (the saying) <hi rend="ital">in light estimation:</hi> others say that it is from <foreign lang="ar">رِسْلٌ</foreign> signifying “ milk; ” which A'Obeyd disallows: IAth says that what is meant by <foreign lang="ar">نجدة</foreign> is straitness and drought or barrenness or dearth; and by <foreign lang="ar">رسل</foreign>, plenty, and abundance of herbage or the like; because <foreign lang="ar">رسل</foreign>, i. e. milk, is plentiful only in the case of abundance of herbage; so that the meaning is, <hi rend="ital">except him who gives forth</hi> the due of God <hi rend="ital">in the case of straitness and in that of plenty.</hi> (TA.)       <sense type="A" n="3">-A3-</sense>  The <foreign lang="ar">رِسْلَانِ</foreign> of a horse are The <hi rend="ital">extremities of the</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">عَضُدَانِ</foreign> [or <hi rend="ital">two arms</hi>]. (M, K. *)    </entryFree>2e:Te17,<entryFree id="n15493" key="رَسَلٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">رَسَلٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> 
                  <hi rend="ital">Camels:</hi> (M, K:) thus expl. by A'Obeyd, without any epithet: (M:) or <hi rend="ital">a drove,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">herd,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a distinct collection</hi> or <hi rend="ital">number,</hi> of camels, (S, M, * Msb, K,) and of sheep or goats, (S, K,) <pb n="1083"/> accord. to ISk <hi rend="ital">from ten to twenty-five,</hi> (TA,) or the <foreign lang="ar">رَسَل</foreign> of the watering-trough is <hi rend="ital">at least ten, and extending to twenty-five;</hi> and the word is masc. and fem.; (M;) and also <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  of horses or horsemen; (S;) applied to <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">a company</hi> of men (Mgh, Msb) as being likened to a drove, or herd, of camels: (Msb:) and also <hi rend="ital">a distinct collection</hi> or <hi rend="ital">number</hi> of any things: (M, K:) pl. <foreign lang="ar">أَرْسَالٌ</foreign>. (S, M, Mgh, Msb, K.) A rájiz says, <quote>
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">يَا ذَائِدَيْهَا خَوِّصَا بِأَرْسَالْ</foreign>
                     </L> 
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">وَلَا تَذُودَاهَا ذِيَادَ الضُّلَّالْ</foreign>
                     </L> 
                  </quote> [<hi rend="ital">O ye two drivers of them, water some before others, by droves, and drive them not with the driving of those who err from the right way</hi>]: (S, TA:) i. e. bring near your camels some after some, and do not let them crowd upon the water-ing-trough. (TA.) And one says, <foreign lang="ar">جَآءَتِ الإِبِلُ رَسَلًا</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">The camels came</hi> [<hi rend="ital">in a drove,</hi> or] <hi rend="ital">following one another.</hi> (IAmb, TA.) And <foreign lang="ar">جَآءَتِ الخَيْلُ أَرْسَالًا</foreign>, i. e. <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  [<hi rend="ital">The horses,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">horsemen, came</hi>] <hi rend="ital">in successive distinct companies.</hi> (S, TA.) And <foreign lang="ar">جَاءُوا أَرْسَالًا</foreign> <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">They</hi> (men) <hi rend="ital">came in successive companies.</hi> (Msb. [And the like is said in the Mgh and in the TA.]) <foreign lang="ar">وَقِيرٌ كَثِيرُ الرَّسَلِ قَلِيلُ الرِّسْلِ</foreign>, occurring in a trad. relating to a drought, is said by IKt to mean [<hi rend="ital">A collection of sheep</hi> or <hi rend="ital">goats</hi>] <hi rend="ital">of which many were sent to the pasture,</hi> i. e. many in number, but <hi rend="ital">having little milk</hi> but the more probable explanation of <foreign lang="ar">كثير الرسل</foreign> is that of El-'Odhree, who says that it means <hi rend="ital">much dispersed in search of pasture:</hi> for the trad. relates that the camels had died, notwithstanding their ability to endure drought: how then should the sheep or goats be safe, and increase so as to become numerous? (IAth, TA.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  Also <hi rend="ital">Animals,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beasts, having milk.</hi> (M, TA.)    </entryFree>2f:T1cc9,<entryFree id="n15498" key="رَسُولٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">رَسُولٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> 
                  <hi rend="ital">i. q.</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">رِسَالَةٌ</foreign>: (S, M, K:) see the latter, in five places.          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  Hence, as meaning <foreign lang="ar">ذُو رَسُولٍ</foreign>, i. e. <foreign lang="ar">ذُو رِسَالَةٍ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">One who has a message;</hi> i. e. <hi rend="ital">a messenger</hi>]; (TA;) <hi rend="ital">i. q.</hi>   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n15498-1" target="مُرْسَلٌ" n="1" type="1" subtype="SO" lang="ar" select="n15505"/></foreign>, (S, M, K,) meaning <hi rend="ital">one sent</hi> with a message; (S;) of the measure <foreign lang="ar">فَعُولٌ</foreign> in the sense of the measure <foreign lang="ar">مَفْعُولٌ</foreign> [or rather <foreign lang="ar">مُفْعَلٌ</foreign>]: (Msb:) [and often meaning <hi rend="ital">an apostle</hi> of God; and with the article <foreign lang="ar">ال</foreign> especially applied to Mohammad:] accord. to IAmb, its meaning in the proper language of the Arabs is <hi rend="ital">one who carries on by consecutive progressions the relation of the tidings of him who has sent him;</hi> taken from the phrase <foreign lang="ar">جَآءَتِ الإِبِلُ رَسَلًا</foreign>, meaning “ The camels came following one another: ” and the saying of the Muëdhdhin, <foreign lang="ar">أَشْهَدُ أَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا رَسُولُ ٱللّٰه</foreign> means <hi rend="ital">I know</hi> [or <hi rend="ital">acknowledge</hi>] <hi rend="ital">and declare that Mohammad is the relater by consecutive progressions of the tidings from God:</hi> (TA:) [or, as commonly understood, <hi rend="ital">I testify that Mohammad is the apostle of God:</hi>] a <foreign lang="ar">رَسُول</foreign> is also called   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n15498-2" target="مِرْسَالٌ" n="2" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n15507"/></foreign>, as being likened to the arrow thus termed: (TA:) the pl. of <foreign lang="ar">رَسُولٌ</foreign> is <foreign lang="ar">رُسُلٌ</foreign> (S, M, Msb, K) and <foreign lang="ar">رُسْلٌ</foreign> (S, Msb) and <foreign lang="ar">رُسَلَآءٌ</foreign>, (M, K,) which last is from IAar, (M,) or Fr, (Sgh,) and <foreign lang="ar">أَرْسُلٌ</foreign>, (M, K,) which [is a pl. of pauc., and] occurs in the saying of the Hudhalee, <quote>
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">لَوْكَانَ فِى قَلْبِى كَقَدْرِ قُلَامَةٍ</foreign>
                     </L> 
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">حُبًا لِغَيْرِكِ قَدْ أَتَاهَا أَرْسُلِى</foreign>
                     </L> 
                  </quote> [<hi rend="ital">Had there been in my heart as much as a nailparing of love for another than thee, my messengers</hi> (or, accord. to the TA, app., <hi rend="ital">my messages</hi>) <hi rend="ital">had come to her</hi>]: respecting which IJ says that he has given to <foreign lang="ar">رَسُولٌ</foreign> this form of pl., which is [regularly] proper to feminines [of this class of words, consisting of four letter whereof the third is a letter of prolongation], such as <foreign lang="ar">أَتَانٌ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">عَنَاقٌ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">عُقَابٌ</foreign>, because women are meant thereby, as they, generally, are the persons required to serve in cases of this kind: (M:) [for] <foreign lang="ar">رَسُولٌ</foreign> is applied without variation to a male and a female, and to one [and to two] and to a pl. number; (S, M, Msb, K;) sometimes: (M:) i. e., it is allowable thus to apply it: (Msb:) hence, (S, K,) in the Kur [xxvi. 15], (S,) <foreign lang="ar">إِنَّا</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">رَسُولُ رَبِّ العَالَمِينَ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">Verily we are the apostles of the Lord of the beings of the whole world</hi>]: (S, K:) MF says, in ch. xx. [verse 49], we find <foreign lang="ar">إِنَّا رَسُولَا رَبِّكَ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">Verily we are the two apostles of thy Lord</hi>]; the dual form being here used: and Z says, in the Ksh, that in this instance it means <hi rend="ital">the messengers,</hi> and therefore the dual form is necessarily used; but in ch. xxvi. it means <hi rend="ital">the message,</hi> and therefore it is allowable to use it alike, when applying it as an epithet, as sing. and dual and pl.: Aboo-Is-hak the Grammarian says that the meaning here is, <foreign lang="ar">إِنَّا رِسَالَةٌ رَبِّ العَالَمِينَ</foreign>, i. e. <foreign lang="ar">ذَوُو رِسالَةِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">Verily we are those that have the message</hi> &amp;c.]: (TA:) [but] <foreign lang="ar">رَسُولٌ</foreign> [as meaning <hi rend="ital">a messenger</hi>] is like <foreign lang="ar">عَدُوٌّ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">صَديقٌ</foreign> [&amp;c.] in its being used alike as masc. and fem. and sing. [and dual] and pl.: (Sgh, TA:) Aboo-Dhu-eyb uses it in the sense of <foreign lang="ar">رُسُل</foreign> in his saying, <quote>
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">أَلِكْنِى إِلَيْهَا وَخَيْرُ الرَّسُو</foreign>
                     </L> 
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">لِ أَعْلَمُهُمْ بِنَوَاحِى الخَبَرْ</foreign>
                     </L> 
                  </quote> [<hi rend="ital">Be thou my messenger to her: and the best of messengers is the most knowing of them in respect of the bounds,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">limits, of the tidings</hi>]. (M.) See 4. The saying in the Kur [xxv. 39], <foreign lang="ar">وَقَوْمَ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">نُوحٍ لَمَّ كَذَّبُوا الرُّسُلَ أَغْرَقْنَاهُمْ</foreign> [lit. <hi rend="ital">And the people of Noah, when they charged with lying the apostles, we drowned them</hi>], Zj says, may mean that they charged with lying Noah alone; for he who charges with lying a prophet charges therewith all the prophets, since they believe in God and in all his apostles; or the general term may be here used as meaning one; like as when you say, <foreign lang="ar">أَنْتَ مِمَّنْ يُنْفِقُ الدَّرَاهِمَ</foreign>, meaning “ Thou art of those who expend the kind of things termed <foreign lang="ar">دراهم</foreign>. ” (M.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  One says also, <foreign lang="ar">السِّهَامُ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">رُسُلُ المَنَايَا</foreign> <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  [<hi rend="ital">Arrows are the messengers of death,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of the decrees of death</hi>]. (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  See also the next paragraph.    </entryFree>30:T1726,<entryFree id="n15499" key="رَسِيلٌ" type="main">

                  <hi rend="ital">Easy:</hi> occurring in the saying of Jubeyhà El-Asadee, <quote>
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">وَقُمْتُ رَسِيلًا بِالَّذِى جَآءَ يَبْتَغِى</foreign>
                     </L> 
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">إِلَيْهِ بَلِيجَ الوَجْهِ لَسْتُ بِبَاسِرِ</foreign>
                     </L> 
                  </quote> [<hi rend="ital">And I undertook,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">managed, with ease, that which he came seeking to obtain; bright in countenance to him: I was not frowning</hi>]. (TA.)       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  Also <hi rend="ital">A stallion-camel</hi> (K, * TA) <hi rend="ital">of the Arabian race, that is sent among the</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">شَوْل</foreign> [or <hi rend="ital">she-camels that have passed seven or eight months since the period of their bringing forth</hi>] <hi rend="ital">in order that he may leap them:</hi> one says, <foreign lang="ar">هٰذَا رَسِيلُ بَنِى فُلَانٍ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">This is the stallion of the camels of the sons of such a one:</hi> and <foreign lang="ar">أَرْسَلَ بَنُو فُلَانٍ رَسِيلَهُمْ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">The sons of such a one sent the stallion of their camels</hi>]: as though it were of the measure <foreign lang="ar">فَعِيلٌ</foreign> in the sense of the measure <foreign lang="ar">مُفْعَلٌ</foreign>, from <foreign lang="ar">أَرْسَلَ</foreign>. (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  And accord. to some, <hi rend="ital">A horse that is started with another in a race.</hi> (Har p. 544.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  [In the CK and in a MS. copy of the K, voce <foreign lang="ar">عَمُودٌ</foreign>, it occurs as though meaning The <hi rend="ital">scout,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">emissary,</hi> or perhaps the <hi rend="ital">advanced guard,</hi> of an army: but in other copies of the K, in this instance, accord. to the TA, and in the L, the word is <foreign lang="ar">رَئِيس</foreign>.]          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">I. q.</hi>   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n15499-1" target="مُرَاسِلٌ" n="1" type="1" subtype="SO" lang="ar" select="n15508"/></foreign> [as meaning <hi rend="ital">one who interchanges messages</hi> or <hi rend="ital">letters with another:</hi> see 3]. (S, K.)          <sense type="b" n="5">-b5-</sense>  The <hi rend="ital">person who stands with thee</hi> (<foreign lang="ar">المُوَاقِفُ لَكَ</foreign> [in the K (in which this explanation is erroneously assigned to   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n15499-2" target="رَسُولٌ" n="2" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n15498"/></foreign>) <foreign lang="ar">المُوَافِقُ لَكَ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">in a competition in shooting</hi> and <hi rend="ital">the like:</hi> (M:) [i. e.] <foreign lang="ar">رَسِيلُ الرَّجُلِ</foreign> signifies <hi rend="ital">he who stands with the man,</hi> (<foreign lang="ar">يَقِفُ مَعَهُ</foreign>, Har p. 544,) or <hi rend="ital">he who acts interchangeably,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">alternates, with the man,</hi> (<foreign lang="ar">يُرَاسِلُهُ</foreign>, S,) <hi rend="ital">in a competition in shooting,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in some other performance.</hi> (S and Har.) And, as also   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n15499-3" target="مُرَاسِلٌ" n="3" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n15508"/></foreign>, <hi rend="ital">One who relieves,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aids, another,</hi> in singing and in work, [<hi rend="ital">by alternating with him,</hi> i. e.,] in the former case, <hi rend="ital">by taking up the strain when the other is unable to continue it</hi> [<hi rend="ital">so as to accomplish the cadence</hi> (see 6)], and in the latter case <hi rend="ital">by taking up the work when the other is unable to continue it;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">one who so relieves,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aids, another</hi> in singing <hi rend="ital">with a high voice;</hi> 
                  <hi rend="ital">i. q.</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">مُتَالٍ</foreign>: or <hi rend="ital">one who aids another,</hi> [or <hi rend="ital">relieves him, by alternating with him,</hi>] or <hi rend="ital">who follows him,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">imitates him,</hi> in his work. (IAar, Msb.) One says, <foreign lang="ar">هُوَ رَسِيلُهُ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">فِى الغِنَآءِ وَنَحْوِهِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">He is the person who relieves him,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aids him, by alternating with him, in singing and the like thereof</hi>]. (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="6">-b6-</sense>  See also <foreign lang="ar">رِسَالَةٌ</foreign>, in two places.       <sense type="A" n="3">-A3-</sense>  Also <hi rend="ital">Wide,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ample.</hi> (K.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  A thing <hi rend="ital">little in quantity,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">incomplete:</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">الشَّىْءُ اللَّطِيفُ</foreign> in the copies of the K should be <pb n="1084"/> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">الشَّىْءُ الطَّفِيفُ</foreign>, as in the Moheet (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  And <hi rend="ital">Sweet</hi> water. (K.)    </entryFree>31:T1372,<entryFree id="n15501" key="رِسَالَةٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">رِسَالَةٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> (S, M, Msb, K) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n15501-1" target="رَسَالَةٌ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n15500"/></foreign> (M, K) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n15501-2" target="رَسُولٌ" n="2" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n15498"/></foreign> (S, M, Msb, K) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n15501-3" target="رَسِيلٌ" n="3" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n15499"/></foreign> (Th, M, K) signify the same, (S, M, Msb, K,) <hi rend="ital">A message;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a letter;</hi> (MA in explanation of the first, and KL in explanation of the first and third;) [<hi rend="ital">a communication sent from one person or party to another, oral or written;</hi>] substs. from <foreign lang="ar">أَرْسَلَ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">إِلَيْهِ</foreign>: (M, K: *) the pl. of the first is <foreign lang="ar">رَسَائِلُ</foreign>; (Msb;) and <foreign lang="ar">أَرْسُلٌ</foreign> is pl. of   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n15501-4" target="رَسُولٌ" n="4" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n15498"/></foreign> in the sense of <foreign lang="ar">رِسَالَةٌ</foreign>, and of the fem. gender. (TA. [See the former of the two verses cited voce <foreign lang="ar">رَسُولٌ</foreign>.]) You say, <foreign lang="ar">أَرْسَلْتُ فُلَانًا فِى رِسَالَةٍ</foreign>: (S:) and <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n15501-5" target="رَسُولًا" n="5" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar"/>أَرْسَلَ إِلَيْهِ</foreign>: (MA:) see 4. A poet says, (S,) namely El-Ash'ar El-Joafee, (TA,) <quote>
                     <L>  
      <foreign lang="ar">أَلَا أَبْلغْ أَبَا عَمْرٍو <ref cref="n15501-6" target="رَسُولًا" n="6" type="1" subtype="SO" lang="ar"/></foreign>
                     </L> 
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">بِأَنِّى عَنْ فُتَاحَتِكُمْ غَنِىُّ</foreign>
                     </L> 
                  </quote> [<hi rend="ital">Now deliver thou to Aboo-' Amr a message, saying that I am in no need of your judging</hi>]: (S:) or <foreign lang="ar">بَنِى عَمْرٍو</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">the sons of ' Amr</hi>]: he means, <foreign lang="ar">عَنْ حُكْمكُمْ</foreign>. (TA.) And hence the saying of Kutheiyir, <quote>
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">لَقَدْ كَذَبَ الوَاشُونَ مَا بُحْتُ عِنْدَهُمْ</foreign>
                     </L> 
                     <L>  
      <foreign lang="ar">بِسِرٍّ وَلَا أَرْسَلْتُهُمْ <ref cref="n15501-7" target="بِرَسُولِ" n="7" type="1" subtype="SO" lang="ar"/></foreign>
                     </L> 
                  </quote> [<hi rend="ital">Assuredly the slanderers have lied: I revealed not in their presence a secret, nor did I send them with a message</hi>]: (S, TA:) or, as some relate the second hemistich, (TA,) <quote>
                     <L>  
      <foreign lang="ar">بِلَيْلَى وَلَا أَرْسَلْتُهُمْ <ref cref="n15501-8" target="بِرَسِيلِ" n="8" type="1" subtype="SO" lang="ar"/></foreign>
                     </L> 
                  </quote> [i. e. I revealed not the case of <hi rend="ital">Leyla, nor did I send them with a message</hi>]: thus cited by Th. (M, TA.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">رِسَالَةٌ</foreign> also signifies [<hi rend="ital">A tract,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">small treatise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">discourse;</hi>] <hi rend="ital">a</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">مَجَلَّة</foreign> [i. e. <hi rend="ital">book,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">writing, relating to science,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on any subject.</hi>] <hi rend="ital">comprising a few questions, inquiries,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">problems, of one kind:</hi> pl. <foreign lang="ar">رَسَائِلُ</foreign>. (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  And <hi rend="ital">Apostleship;</hi> the <hi rend="ital">apostolic office</hi> or <hi rend="ital">function.</hi> (MA.)          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">أُمُّ رِسَالَةَ</foreign> [in a copy of the K <foreign lang="ar">أُمُّ رِسَالَةٍ</foreign>] <hi rend="ital">The</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">رَخَمَة</foreign> [or <hi rend="ital">female of the vultur percnopterus,</hi> in the CK <foreign lang="ar">رَحْمَة</foreign>]: (M, K, TA:) a surname thereof. (TA.)    </entryFree>32:Ta68,<entryFree id="n15505" key="مُرْسَلٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">مُرْسَلٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form>: see <foreign lang="ar">رَسُولٌ</foreign>, second sentence.          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  Applied to a tradition (<foreign lang="ar">حَدِيثٌ</foreign>), it means <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  <hi rend="ital">Of which the ascription is not traced up so as to reach to its author:</hi> (Msb:) [i.e.] <foreign lang="ar">الأَحَادِيثُ المُرْسَلَةُ</foreign> means <hi rend="ital">the traditions which one relates as on the authority of a</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">تَابِعِىّ</foreign>, (K TA,) <hi rend="ital">by tracing up the ascription thereof uninterruptedly to him,</hi> (TA,) <hi rend="ital">when the</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">تابعىّ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">says,</hi> “ <hi rend="ital">The Apostle of God</hi> (<hi rend="ital">May God bless and save him</hi>) <hi rend="ital">said,</hi> ” <hi rend="ital">without mentioning a</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">صَحَابِىّ</foreign> (K, TA) <hi rend="ital">who heard it from the Apostle of God:</hi> (TA: [and the like is said in the Mgh:]) <foreign lang="ar">مَرَاسِيلُ</foreign> is the [pl. or] quasi-pl. n. of <foreign lang="ar">مُرْسَلٌ</foreign> thus used, [or rather used as a subst., or as an epithet in which the quality of a subst. is predominant,] like as <foreign lang="ar">مَنَاكِيرُ</foreign> is of <foreign lang="ar">مُنْكَرٌ</foreign>. (Mgh.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  In lexicology, it means, like <foreign lang="ar">مُنْقَطِعٌ</foreign>, <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  That <hi rend="ital">of which the series of transmitters is interrupted:</hi> as a word &amp;c. handed down by IDrd as on the authority of AZ [with whom he was not contemporary, without his mentioning the intermediate transmitters]: and such is not admitted [as unquestionable]; because exactness is a condition of the admission of what is transmitted, and the exactness of him who is not mentioned is not known. (Mz 4th <foreign lang="ar">نوع</foreign>.)          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">مَجَازٌ مُرْسَلٌ</foreign>: see art. <foreign lang="ar">جوز</foreign>.          <sense type="b" n="5">-b5-</sense>  [See also the next paragraph.]    </entryFree>33:T56a,<entryFree id="n15506" key="مُرْسَلَةٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">مُرْسَلَةٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> 
                  <hi rend="ital">A</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">قِلَادَة</foreign> [or <hi rend="ital">necklace</hi>], (M,) or <hi rend="ital">a long</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">قلادة</foreign>, (IDrd, O, K,) <hi rend="ital">that falls upon the bosom:</hi> (IDrd, M, O, K:) or <hi rend="ital">a</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">قلادة</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">upon which are beads</hi> &amp;c. (Yz, O, K.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  As used in the Kur [lxxvii. 1], (M,) <foreign lang="ar">المُرْسَلَاتُ</foreign> means <hi rend="ital">The winds</hi> (S, M, K, TA) <hi rend="ital">that are sent forth,</hi> [by <foreign lang="ar">عُرْفًا</foreign>, which follows it, being meant consecutively,] like [the several portions of] the mane of the horse: (TA:) or <hi rend="ital">the angels</hi> [so <hi rend="ital">sent forth</hi>]: (Th, S, M, K, TA:) or <hi rend="ital">the horses</hi> (M, K, TA) <hi rend="ital">that are started,</hi> [one following another,] in the racecourse. (TA.)    </entryFree>34:T6e0,<entryFree id="n15508" key="مُرَاسِلٌ" type="main">
